intro: Tetraceratium quadricorne, commonly known as the four-horned tetraceratium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its quadrangular stems and palmate leaves with four lobes. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically producing yellowish or greenish petals. Tetraceratium quadricorne is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
